strow.stentry: The folder into which the source code for the new service is to be stored. By default this is the current project's src folder.
The package that is to contain the new service. By default this is the current project's package.
The name to be used for the class that implements the service. This should be a simple, non-qualified name.

(optional) The label for the service. This label is displayed to the user, often along with the service's icon, when the service needs to be identified to the user. Note that if you specify a label, the New Service wizard creates a string resource to hold this value. If the Default option is selected, a label is not set for this service (the Label field is not editable); the user sees the application's label instead.
The class from which the service inherits. For services, this is android.app.Service.
(optional) Permissions that should be added to the project's manifest file due to this service. Click Add to display a list of possible permissions from which you can select.

section.p: The New Service wizard can optionally include empty onCreate() and onStart() methods.
